name: The Bell of Mourning Echoes
desc: A warrior who walks the abyss seeks to carry out an as-yet unfulfilled oath...

customize.text:
The Unlock Requirements can be done in any order. The World Quest will begin after obtaining the 3 Quest Items.
Regardless of the order of locations players go to, they will obtain the items in this order:

customize.name: Undying One's Mourning Bell
customize.desc: A bronze bell that was carried by a warrior who strode the dark abyss. Its peal can be heard on pitch-black nights.

customize.name: A Horn Unwinded
customize.desc: A horn that was once used to summon those who had sworn oaths. It has long since lost its purpose.

customize.name: Dyed Tassel
customize.desc: An ancient heavy helmet. It is an heirloom that bears the mark of a venerable lineage of northern warriors.

customize.text: Go to the waypoint Northeast of the domain in <color=#ece5d8>Lempo Isle</color> .

Defeat the Wild Hunt enemies to obtain one of the quest items.
The following enemies will appear during the fight:

customize.name: Wilderness Exile
customize.desc:
A ghoul that stalks the frozen wilderness when the pitch-dark mist rolls in. Their emergence presages worse calamities to come.
All who dwell beneath the moon set out on journeys with their own goals and wishes in mind, but not all such wishes receive favor. Spirits that cannot rest due to engendered resentment, partings with loved ones, or desires that go unfulfilled, if corrupted by the Abyss, may transform into ghouls, forever lost in the thick mists of the Wild Hunt.

customize.text: Go Northwest of the waypoint in <color=#ece5d8>Starsand Shoal</color> .

Defeat the Wild Hunt enemies and open the Precious Chest to obtain one of the quest items.
The following enemies will appear during the fight:

customize.name: Wilderness Hunter
customize.desc:
A ghoul that stalks the frozen wilderness when the pitch-dark mist rolls in. Their emergence presages worse calamities to come.
Many great champions of a lost ancient kingdom lie buried beneath the frozen northlands. Though the remnants of the past have been long wiped clean, these noble spirits yet defend their golden homeland. Awakened by Abyssal taint, these warriors now see all who trespass as prey.

customize.text: Go to the small Western island in <color=#ece5d8>Clink-Clank Krumkake Craftshop</color> .

Defeat the Wild Hunt enemies and open the Exquisite Chest to obtain one of the quest items.
The following enemies will appear during the fight:

All who dwell beneath the moon set out on journeys with their own goals and wishes in mind, but not all such wishes receive favor. Spirits that cannot rest due to engendered resentment, partings with loved ones, or desires that go unfulfilled, if corrupted by the Abyss, may transform into ghouls, forever lost in the thick mists of the Wild Hunt.

customize.name: Thundercraven Rifthound Whelp
customize.desc:
A beast with monstrous blood that is capable of eroding the boundaries of the world. "Gold" classified them as "Alfisol."
The previous eras, when giant monstrous beasts descended, large swarms of these hounds would go before them to deliquesce the borders of the world and open the way.

customize.name: Thundercraven Rifthound
customize.desc:
A beast with monstrous blood that is capable of eroding the boundaries of the world. They were created by "Gold."
Once upon a time, they ran riot across the continent, but they went extinct for a time due to resistance and mass hunts. Recently, however, they have re-emerged. The pack of black wolves that now threaten Springvale and Wolvendom are such creatures.

customize.text:
<color=#ece5d8>Nasha Town, Nod-Krai</color>
<color=#ffffff>Quest Description:</color> <color=#ffffff>A warrior who walks the abyss seeks to carry out an as-yet unfulfilled oath...</color>
Quest Objective: Head to Nasha Town and look for Lightkeepers to learn more
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Just a moment, if you don't mind! There's something Paimon wants to ask you two...
<color=#ffffff>You present the items you obtained earlier to the two Lightkeepers. You also tell them about how a strange figure, dressed in Lightkeeper garb, fought by your side to repel the Wild Hunt...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Lushne:</color> ...Could it have been Sigurd? He hasn't been able to rest in peace, even until now, it seems. If only I could...
<color=#ffffff>Sukhovykh:</color> Cut it out, Lushne. This is not your burden to bear alone. As long as the Hunt exists, he will continue to fight them. All we can do is to fulfill our mission as best as we can.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Sooo... this Sigurd, he used to be a Lightkeeper as well, right?
<color=#ffffff>Sukhovykh:</color> Yes. He was a formidable Starshyna, and when the Wild Hunt swept over Nod-Krai, he fought valiantly till the end.
<color=#ffffff>Sukhovykh:</color> It's said that even mindless beasts flinch when they hear his warning bell, chilled to the bone and too terrified to press onward... And yet, you two somehow managed to recover his relics. How curious...
<color=#ffffff>Sukhovykh:</color> If you can, please take those relics to his grave. It lies near the eastern battlefield ruins on Lempo Isle.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> Will do.
<color=#ffffff>Sukhovykh:</color> Thank you. May the day soon come when his spirit may rest...
<color=#ece5d8>Lempo Isle, Nod-Krai</color>
Quest Objective: Take the relics back to Sigurd's grave
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> This must be Sigurd's grave. It's the only one around, after all...
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Anyway... Let's give his stuff back to him, shall we?
<color=#ffffff>Engraved Inscription:</color> Pro aris et focis.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> (Return the relics.)
<color=#ffffff>???:</color> ...The Wild Hunt... permeates...
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Traveler, do you hear that? It sounds like...
<color=#ffffff>???:</color> ...Do you pursue the Wild Hunt, or do you hunt with them...?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: (Ready up...)</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: (Leave for now.)</color>
